review.title: Integrating Fuzzy and Ant Colony System for Fuzzy Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows
review.abstract: In this paper fuzzy VRPTW with an uncertain travel time is considered. Credibility theory is used to model the problem and specifies a preference index at which it is desired that the travel times to reach the customers fall into their time windows. We propose the integration of fuzzy and ant colony system based evolutionary algorithm to solve the problem while preserving the constraints. Computational results for certain benchmark problems having short and long time horizons are presented to show the effectiveness of the algorithm. Comparison between different preferences indexes have been obtained to help the user in making suitable decisions.

metadata.title: Integrating Fuzzy and Ant Colony System for Fuzzy Vehicle Routing Problem with Time Windows

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijcsa.2014.4506 73In this paper, the blurred VRPTW is considered with an uncertain travel time. To model the problem, credibility theory is used and a preference index is defined where it is desirable that travel times to reach customers fall within their time frames. We propose the integration of an evolutionary algorithm based on blur and ant colonies to solve the problem while maintaining the constraints. Calculation results for certain benchmark problems with short and long time horizons are presented to demonstrate the effectiveness of the algorithm.
